SEARCH
Package server.Model

Class LivingRoom

java.lang.Object
Observer.LivingRoomObservable
server.Model.LivingRoom
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, SimpleLivingRoom
public class LivingRoom extends LivingRoomObservable implements Serializable, SimpleLivingRoom
This Class represents the LivingRoom as described in the Game Rules. The LivingRoom main component is the gameTable: a bi-dimensional Array of ItemTile which is represented by a matrix with 9 columns and 9 rows. There are 3 different LivingRoom patterns depending on the number of Players in the match. The LivingRoom also contains the 2 CommonGoals chosen randomly at the beginning of the match. Have a look at MyShelfie RuleBook for further information
See Also:

      public void fillVoid(int x, int y, PlayableItemTile tile)

      Parameters:
      x - the 'x' position in the LivingRoom of the ItemTile to check
      y - the 'y' position in the LivingRoom of the ItemTile to check
      tile - the PlayableItemTile to put into the empty cell

    • updateAvailability

      public void updateAvailability()
      This method decides for each ItemTile in the LivingRoom if it is available or not during the turn of the CurrentPlayer.

    • updateAdjacentAvailabilityV1

      public void updateAdjacentAvailabilityV1(int x, int y)
      This method is used after the Player has picked the first PlayableItemTile from the LivingRoom during the current turn. The method decides, for each ItemTile in the LivingRoom, whether it is adjacent or not to the previously picked PlayableItemTile. If all the checks are successful, then the ItemTile is made adjacent.

    • resetAdjacentAvailability

      public void resetAdjacentAvailability()
      Sets the variable adjacency to false for every ItemTile in the LivingRoom

    • updateAdjacentAvailabilityV2

      public void updateAdjacentAvailabilityV2(int x, int y, int firstX, int firstY)
      This method is used after the Player has picked the second PlayableItemTile from the LivingRoom during the current turn. The method decides, for each ItemTile in the LivingRoom, whether it is adjacent or not to one of the previously picked PlayableItemTiles and, if it is, also checks if the ItemTile stands in the same row (if the first 2 picked PlayableItemTiles were in the same row of the Livingroom) or in the same column (if the first 2 picked PlayableItemTiles were in the same column of the Livingroom) of the other 2 picked PlayableItemTiles. If all the checks are successful, then the ItemTile becomes adjacent.
